Detailed Description

A polygon that describes one feature in the vector map.

Member Function Documentation

void GfxPolygon::addCoordinate (  int32  lat,
int32  lon
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Add new coordinates without specifying the previous ones.

O(1) complexity if the coordinates are represented by absolute 32 bit coordinates (a GfxCoordinates32 object), O(n) complexity if the coordinates are represented by relative 16 bit coordinates (a GfxCoordinates16 object), where n is the number of coordinates added so far. Use with care! Rather use the other version of addCoordinate().

Parameters:
lat Latitude to add.
lon Longitude to add.

Definition at line 404 of file GfxPolygon.h.

References GfxCoordinates::addCoordinate(), and m_coords.

void GfxPolygon::addCoordinate (  int32  lat,
int32  lon,
int32  prevLat,
int32  prevLon
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Add new coordinates.

O(1) complexity regardless of internal represenation of the coordinates. Prefer this method to addCoordinate( int32 lat, int32 lon ).

Parameters:
lat Latitude to add.
lon Longitude to add.
prevLat Previous latitude. Ignored if no previous coordinates exist.
prevLon Previous longitude. Ignored if no previous coordinates exist.

int32 GfxPolygon::getLat (  uint32  i  )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Get the i:th latitude without specifying the previous latitude.

O(1) complexity if the coordinates are represented by absolute 32 bit coordinates (a GfxCoordinates32 object), O(n) complexity if the coordinates are represented by relative 16 bit coordinates (a GfxCoordinates16 object), where n is the number of coordinates added so far. Use with care! Rather use getLat( uint32 i, int32 prevLat ) if possible.

Parameters:
i Coordinate number to get.
Returns:
The latitude.

Definition at line 346 of file GfxPolygon.h.

References GfxCoordinates::getLat(), and m_coords.

int32 GfxPolygon::getLat (  uint32  i,
int32  prevLat
)  const [inline]
 

Get the i:th latitude.

O(1) complexity regardless of the internal representation of the coordinates. Prefer this method to getLat( uint32 i ).

Parameters:
i Coordinate number to get.
prevLat The latitude at position i-1. If i == 0 then this parameter is ignored.
Returns:
The latitude.

int32 GfxPolygon::getLon (  uint32  i  )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Get the i:th longitude without specifying the previous longitude.

O(1) complexity if the coordinates are represented by absolute 32 bit coordinates (a GfxCoordinates32 object), O(n) complexity if the coordinates are represented by relative 16 bit coordinates (a GfxCoordinates16 object), where n is the number of coordinates added so far. Use with care! Rather use getLon( uint32 i, int32 prevLon ) if possible.

Parameters:
i Coordinate number to get.
Returns:
The longitude.

bool GfxPolygon::usesCoordinates16Bits (   )  const [inline, virtual]
